image.altText: An illustration of a woman and child in front of a tiled background.

props.synopsis: In a country where dissidents face arrest or even execution, 10 Iranians — including a teacher, a mother, and a labourer — put themselves at risk to document the war.

title.children: The voices from inside Iran the regime doesn't want you to hear

image.altText: a weather graph over nsw of a forecast weather bomb

props.synopsis: Forget the headlines and hyperbole of the fictitious "rain bomb" — the real weather bomb is possible along Australia's east coast next week.

title.children: 'Bomb cyclone' ahead for Australia's east coast

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: This is why the world’s richest people — also known as the 'broligarchs' — are about to get a whole lot richer.

title.children: How Trump's tax triumph will cost Australians dearly

image.altText: Two men hold aloft a red and white banner outside a court which reads 'MAGA justices are taking away our hard-won rights'

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is celebrating what he calls a "giant win" after the US Supreme Court limited the power of federal judges to block the president's executive orders.

title.children: 'Giant win' for Trump after top court limits judges' power to block his orders

image.altText: Mechelle Turvey and Stephen Cleal hug outside court.

props.synopsis: After three years, a national outcry, and the sentencing of her son's murderers, Mechelle Turvey is still a force for change.

title.children: It took years to sentence her son's killers. Mechelle Turvey knew the truth

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood celebrates

props.synopsis: A stunning Josh Hazlewood spell of 4-5 in five overs has the West Indies reeling as they chase an increasingly unlikely 301 to win the third Test in Barbados. Follow live.

title.children: Hazlewood has five wickets as Aussies close on victory

image.altText: Trump and Xi shake hands with the American and Chinese flags in the background

props.synopsis: China has confirmed the details of the framework will include Washington looking at "restrictive measures", while Beijing will "review and approve" items under export control.

title.children: US and China sign trade deal after months-long tariff war

image.altText: People carrying white bags over their heads as they walk in front of a damaged building

props.synopsis: Israeli strike hits a street where witnesses said people were getting bags of flour from a Palestinian police unit that had confiscated the goods from looters.

title.children: Israel's military orders probe into possible war crimes after deaths near Gaza aid sites

image.altText: mum and daughter sit on the floor

props.synopsis: Families of children living with a disability in regional and remote areas fear their kids may lose their independence due to cuts to NDIS provider rates.

title.children: NDIS travel cuts could leave kids in regional areas without care

image.altText: Sydney player Joel Amartey has his arms outstreched in celebration and an open mouthed smile.

props.synopsis: Brandon Walker, Joel Amartey, Isaac Quaynor and Connor Idun all have a rich Ghanaian heritage that's shaping the way they play.

title.children: The Ghanaian-Australian quartet making a mark on the AFL

image.altText: A robot shaped like a human, wearing a sports singlet, runs on a road with three people and thousands of marathon runners.

props.synopsis: China is now competing with the United States in the race to find a breakthrough moment with machines set to transform economies.

title.children: China vies to win humanoid robot race against US

image.altText: A row of champagne flutes.

props.synopsis: There were 91 Australians who earned more than $1 million in total income yet paid no tax in 2022-23, while Australia's highest earners live in Sydney's eastern suburbs, taking in Darling Point, Edgecliff, Rushcutters and Point Piper, according to newly released data from the Australian Taxation Office (ATO).

title.children: 91 millionaires paid no tax, ATO data reveals

image.altText: An unidentified person rolls a suitcase and carries a coles bag through the Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: Do you really know what your travel insurance covers? We spoke to the experts to find out exactly what you're entitled to when a conflict breaks or a natural disaster unfolds.

title.children: Going on a big trip? Here's what your travel insurance might not cover

image.altText: A man in a black “Tathra Place” cap and farm jacket sits inside a barn filled with ducklings.

props.synopsis: Former Sydney electrician Luke Winder has built one of Australia's largest free-range duck farms on the Southern Tablelands of New South Wales, after teaching himself regenerative farming via YouTube.

title.children: Farmer who gambled on a dream raises award-winning free-range ducks

image.altText: A woman in a white jumper is holding a book open, smiling

props.synopsis: It's a story that became Aussie folklore, but for the descendants of those involved, the ripple effects of that frosty night 145 years ago would be felt for generations.

title.children: Fallout from Ned Kelly's last stand haunted families for generations

image.altText: Maya Joint clenches her fist and smiles after winning a match at the Eastbourne Open

props.synopsis: Maya Joint has continued her extraordinary rise, reaching the final of another WTA event at the age of just 19.

title.children: Joint into Eastbourne Open final as teenager's Wimbledon prospects grow

image.altText: Nic White of the Western Force about to catch a rugby ball which is comng towards him at chest height

props.synopsis: It has been 12 long years in the making, and Nic White has said it will be a dream come true when he gets his chance to play against the British and Irish Lions on Saturday night.

title.children: 'Don't get injured': White's 12-year wait to play the Lions ends

image.altText: A composite image showing eight book covers on a blue and purple background

props.synopsis: A queer thriller, new novels from some of Australia's biggest authors and luminous short stories are all on offer this month in our critics' top picks. They'll take you from South London to New Zealand to a post-apocalyptic future — and beyond.

title.children: The books our critics couldn't put down in June

image.altText: A close up selfie of a woman wearing a cap and headphones

props.synopsis: Former reality TV contestant Tamika Chesser, who has been charged with the murder of her partner, has appeared in court. SA Police say they are yet to locate some of the man's remains. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Beauty and the Geek contestant accused of murder, police search for missing remains

image.altText: Police at house

props.synopsis: A Universal Store spokesperson says their sincere thoughts and condolences are with Greg Josephson's family at this very sad time.

title.children: Universal Store co-founder identified as alleged murder victim

image.altText: Uniformed NSW Police officer walking through glass sliding doors.

props.synopsis: Online violent extremist group Terrorgram, which was formally listed today as a terror organisation, has been linked to an alleged plot to kill a NSW MP.

title.children: Terrorgram linked to alleged plot to kill Labor politician

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The judge in Erin Patterson's murder trial has warned jurors not to reason that Erin Patterson is guilty just because they think she has lied, as he continues his final instructions to the panel.

title.children: Judge tells Erin Patterson jurors not to find her guilty just because she lied

image.altText: Three door snakes up against doors

props.synopsis: As the first month of winter is almost over, we ask ABC readers to share their tips on how to save money without sacrificing comfort.

title.children: Cost-effective ways of heating your home this winter

image.altText: Jim Chalmers with Scott Bessent and Kevin Hassett stand smiling, flanked by Australian and US flags.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers welcomes the news that Australian investors will likely escape a 15 per cent tax that would have been imposed on them as part of Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill".

title.children: Reprieve for Australian super funds as US dumps 'revenge tax'

image.altText: two nsw police officers stand next to woman injured after a protest in belmore, the woman's eye is bloodied

props.synopsis: Former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas has been hospitalised after being injured during an arrest at a pro-Palestinian protest.

title.children: Former Greens candidate 'struck in the eye' during arrest at Sydney protest

image.altText: An elderly woman with short, white hair.

props.synopsis: Judges have reserved their decision on whether to allow the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions to appeal a sentence given to a former police officer over the death of 95-year-old Clare Nowland.

title.children: Court hears Kristian White gave 95yo 'no way' to avoid being tasered

image.altText: A man in a grey pullover sits in back seat of police car covering his face with his hands.

props.synopsis: Japan hangs the "Twitter killer" who murdered and dismembered nine people he met online, in the nation's first enactment of the death penalty since 2022.

title.children: 'Twitter killer' who murdered nine hanged in Japan's first execution since 2022

image.altText: A nurse prepares a flu shot from a vaccine vial

props.synopsis: Thimerosal is only used in multi-dose vials of flu shots in the US during the 2024-25 flu season, despite decades of studies showing no related safety issues.

title.children: Robert Kennedy's vaccine panel backs change to US flu vaccine

image.altText: A sign on a brick wall reads 'Western Sydney University', in the distance are some large buildings.

props.synopsis: After a Sydney university was warned for allowing sanctioned Iranian state broadcaster PressTV on campus, Liberal senator Dave Sharma says it should not be the university enforcing sanctions, but DFAT.

title.children: Sharma says sanctions warning to university 'shooting the messenger'

image.altText: A black and white close-up of Anna Wintour in a diamond necklace, jacket with her signature bob and dark sunglasses

props.synopsis: As Anna Wintour steps down as editor of US Vogue after almost 40 years in the role, one thing seems clear: her legacy is as astonishing as her rise.

title.children: Anna Wintour redefined fashion. Her legacy is as astonishing as her rise

image.altText: Indonesian police escorting a criminal

props.synopsis: Police say that two Australians are suspected of arriving on a scooter and opening fire, and another of facilitating the crime.

title.children: Indonesian police reveal more details of fatal shooting of Australian man in Bali

image.altText: A graphic shows David Crisafulli alongside receipt snippets, laid over the SET Solutions website.

props.synopsis: A Queensland parliamentary committee has cleared David Crisafulli of wrongdoing.

title.children: Committee finds premier failed to declare $200,000 payment to liquidators

image.altText: A profile shot of Jeff McCloy leaning against a brick wall

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old, diagnosed with motor neurone disease about 12 months ago, ended his life with voluntary assisted dying.

title.children: Former Newcastle mayor Jeff McCloy dies after battle with MND

image.altText: woman's face with trees in background

props.synopsis: Almost three months after the missing Roma woman's body was found in bushland and five months after she went missing, a coroner will receive details of the investigation.

title.children: Police to send report into Taylor Spies death to coroner

image.altText: Ilotopie performers coated head to toe in pink photorapher from behind, feat their naked bottoms painted pink

props.synopsis: Thirty years after they were thrown into an Adelaide prison for public nudity, legendary French street artists Ilotopie returned to the scene of the crime — as nude, and as proud, as ever.

title.children: Naked street artists return 30 years after arrests
